reviewText: This is the amazingly interesting story of a woman who did things that most men would never dream of or accomplish. I saw it first on PBS and sought it out on Amazon.  I wish I could have met her.

reviewText: If you love true stories about smart, independent & successful women or just "characters", this one's for you! If you love flying, this one's for you! If you love stories about the first astronauts or WWII Airmen, this one's for you! If you loved "The Right Stuff" this one's for you! I loved this film!

reviewText: Great educational video.  But most of all Pancho was one of the Greatest American's that ever lived.  I just wish the video "Pancho Barnes" with Valerie Bertinelli was on DVD too.  I think Kim Stanley in "The Right Stuff"  had a better grasp on how Pancho acted.  Though Bertinelli had no idea how to pro tray Pancho because Pancho really could get her own way at times, and she much louder than life it self.  This video that was put out gets as close to Pancho as you can imagine.

reviewText: They just don't make people like her anymore.  Pancho would've never been able to be who she was in today's PC America.  She was her own person in an era when you could be anything you set your mind to being.  That's not possible anymore.  Watch this great story and weep for the America that is no more.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Nick Spark's excellent documentary was wonderful viewing for me personally , because I first met Pancho at an airshow/fundraiser in 1972. I'd just been out flying open-cockpit with a buddy, and (Gods' truth) introduced myself to her wearing a leather flight jacket and carrying my helmet and goggles. She looked me up and down, cocked an eyebrow, and said precisely nothing. Unpromising as that beginning was, I became friendly with her son Bill and his wife Shoulang. Pancho wasn't in good health then, and her energies were intermittent; but I'd read a transcipt of Don Kuhns' taped interview with Pancho (featured on this DVD), and had a healthy respect for what she'd accomplished in her life. I was also glad to see her honored as a guest at a major aviation function (Pancho in silver-lame evening wear was a sight to behold, surrounded by friends who regarded with a respect which she richly deserved). She was an amazing woman, and I'm glad to see her place in aviation history so well acknowledged.
summary: Pancho Barnes: A Tough, Tender, Surprising Legend

reviewText: It's hard to believe I don't remember ever hearing of Pancho Barnes growing up, but many of the people in the story were American heros.  Really good story of her life.

reviewText: Quite a colorful person that isn't an A-List historic person because of the shunning of expectation to chase her own dreams. What an amazing trend buster and overall good person, though extraordinarilyUnpredictable. It was a great bit of history with a hard ending. I enjoyed the history I had never heard and the behind the scenes of events I had, but never with this perspective of events. Rest in peace Pancho Barnes.
